intro: Siphocampylus urbanii, commonly known as the Urban's siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in dry, open habitats. Its flowers are small and clustered, usually white or pale green, and it produces distinctive, elongated fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
